problem_text:
Let G be a finite group, and V(ZG) the group of normalized units of the integral group ring of G. Do the spectra of G and V(ZG) coincide? That is, is it true that, for any integer n, there is an element of order n in V(ZG) if and only if there is an element of order n in G?
The answer is “yes” if G is solvable (M. Hertweck, Comm. Algebra 36 (2008), 3585–3588).
A. B¨achle, L. Margolis
answer: The answer is “yes” if G is solvable (M. Hertweck, Comm. Algebra 36 (2008), 3585–3588).
